action.action-desc: Mr. Rosendale (for himself and Ms. Houlahan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 to exempt industrial hemp from certain requirements under the hemp production program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Industrial Hemp Act of 2023.

section.header: Exemptions of industrial hemp under hemp production program

subsection.text: Section 297A of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1639o) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and;
by striking means the plant and inserting the following: “means—
the plant
by adding at the end the following:
industrial hemp.

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (3) through (6) as paragraphs (4) through (7), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (2) the following:
The term industrial hemp means the plant Cannabis sativa L. if the harvested material is only—

clause.text: the stalks of that plant;
fiber produced from those stalks; or
any other manufacture, derivative, mixture, or preparation of those stalks (except cannabinoid resin extracted from those stalks);

subparagraph.text: whole grain, oil, cake, nut, hull, or any other compound, manufacture, derivative, mixture, or preparation of the seeds of that plant (except cannabinoid resin extracted from the seeds of that plant); or
viable seeds of that plant produced solely for production or manufacture of any material described in subparagraph (A) or (B).

subsection.text: Section 297B of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1639p) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)(A)—

clause.text: by redesignating clauses (ii) through (vii) as clauses (iii) through (viii), respectively;
by inserting after clause (i) the following:
a procedure by which a hemp producer shall designate the type of production of the hemp producer as—
in clause (iii) (as so redesignated), by inserting , excluding industrial hemp, after hemp; and
in clause (viii) (as so redesignated), by striking (vi) and inserting (vii);

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking Nothing and inserting Except as provided in subparagraph (C), nothing; and
by adding at the end the following:
Except as provided in clause (ii), no State or Indian tribe may establish or continue in effect any law that—

subclause.text: regulates the production of industrial hemp in compliance with this subtitle; and
is more stringent than this subtitle.

clause.text: Clause (i) shall not apply to any law relating to any violation of or described in subsection (e)(3).

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: With respect to annual inspections of industrial hemp producers under paragraph (2)(A)(vi)—

subparagraph.text: the inspection shall be a visual inspection;

if a producer fails a visual inspection under subparagraph (A), the State or Indian tribe may require the producer to provide to the State or Indian tribe documentation that demonstrates a clear intent and in-field practices consistent with the designation of the type of production as industrial hemp under paragraph (2)(A)(ii)(I), including seed tags, sales contracts, a Farm Service Agency report, harvest techniques, or a harvest inspection; and

if a producer fails to provide documentation demonstrating a clear intent and in-field practices described in subparagraph (B), the State or Indian tribe may require chemical testing on harvested material of the producer that failed the visual inspection under subparagraph (A).

clause.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Production inconsistent with industrial hemp designation
subparagraph.text: Any person who knowingly produces a crop that is inconsistent with the designation of the type of production of the person as industrial hemp under subsection (a)(2)(A)(ii)(I) shall be ineligible to participate in the program established under this section for a period of 5 years beginning on the date of the violation.

section.text: The Secretary of Agriculture shall promulgate regulations and guidelines to implement the amendments made by this Act as expeditiously as practicable.
